title: How to Remove the Smell of Cat Urine from Running Shoes

steps.headline: Find a plastic bag large enough to fit the shoes.
steps.description: It will also need to have enough space to tie up once the shoes are inside.

steps.headline: Place a handful of baking soda into the plastic bag.
Place the offending shoes into the plastic bag.
Tie the bag up.
steps.description: Shake vigorously to get the baking soda all over the shoes.

steps.headline: Leave the shoes in the bag for the next 5 days.
steps.description: Longer than this is fine too.

steps.headline: Remove the shoes outside or somewhere that you can shake them, like the bathroom.
steps.description: Shake the baking soda off the shoes completely.

steps.headline: Place the shoes in the sunshine for a day.
steps.description: The sunshine is important, so if it's too cold or raining, place them in a windowsill for the day or more.

tyn: Plastic bag, large enough to fit shoes
Rubber band to tie bag up with (optional)
